results.title: Principal Product Manager, Analytics
results.description:
Our growing Product Team is looking for a humble and hungry Principal Product Manager to help lead our Analytics, DataLake, and Reporting experiences. These products provide invaluable insight and actionable information for finance, project management, and leadership users of our feature-rich and open Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) platform.  

You will contribute to the strategic vision and own the delivery of our analytics and reporting solutions. With over 3,500 customers and a robust partner network, your actions and contributions will have far-reaching impacts on our project-based ERP software offering. 

What You'll Do 

  • Develop a deep understanding of user personas across business lines; leverage the same to be the sounding board for internal and external stakeholders and customers
  • Collaborate and contribute to building and updating our product roadmap for analytics, reporting, and DataLake
  • Transition proof-of-concepts to production-ready features
  • Partner with numerous stakeholders and cross-functional teams to execute our roadmap, including sprint planning and objective prioritization of features and issues
  • Become a Unanet go-to product expert; guide your scrum teams in troubleshooting production-escalation issues with your team leadership skills; train internal and external customers on new product features, capabilities, data objects, and integrations
  • Set your engineering team up for success in sprint activities, providing them with relevant user stories and guiding them in estimation
  • Reduce friction in our Agile processes when the situation calls for adjustments or changes in both the sprint and the overall strategic plan

Your First 90 Days 

In your First 30 Days, you will grow in your understanding of Unanet through the lens of our current product offerings. You will learn what is slated to be delivered over the coming two (2) quarters. With this knowledge, you will help clarify and realign existing requirements, writing epics and user stories as well as refining them with your team.  

In your First 60 Days, you will build relationships with internal and external stakeholders and help them understand our product direction and the reasoning behind it. You will understand the strategic direction of your product as well as related Unanet products and how they all work together. In partnership with your Group Product Manager and our User Experience Team, you will question, redefine, revalidate and solidify our roadmap deliverables based on your expertise and learnings. 

In your First 90 Days, you will drive our release and Go-to-Market (GTM) plan for the Analytics product deliverables. You will use the Analytics product roadmap to make commitments, evaluate client suggestions, and define metrics for adoption and engagement. You will be the guiding light for your scrum teams, helping them execute on the committed product deliverables.  

Who You Are 

  • 7+ years of B2B SaaS product management experience in an Agile environment
  • Prior experience working with analytics, data visualization, BI tooling, accounting, financials, government contracting (GovCon), or financial reporting
  • Product strategist with ability to align vision to defined outcomes
  • Strong ability to capture, detail, and explain market and technical requirements
  • Strong technical writing and visualization skills
  • Demonstrable ability to understand and evaluate customer and end-user needs
  • Depth of experience planning and supporting multi-functional web applications in production, with deploying new products and major functionality
  • Ability to identify gaps, program risks and proactively address them
  • Bias for action and execution on both short- and long-term strategic product plans

Your Differentiators 

  • Prior experience working with ERP financials and/or have an accounting background

Our Values 

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $140,000 – 160,000 per year. You will be eligible for employee equity as well as discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits. 

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Senior Manager of Partner Enablement
results.description:
We have an opening for a Senior Manager of Partner Enablement to join our growing Partnerships team. This role will be the primary driver of key relationships, building rapport, buy in, and shared value with our strategic partner network. We’d expect this individual to play a significant role in shaping the culture and operational processes for a growing department and be a key driver of revenue for the wider organization. This role will report to our Senior Director of Partnerships.

An ideal candidate will be motivated by strategically maximizing channels to revenue, nurturing strategic relationships, and is energized by playing a pivotal role in an ambitious, mission orientated start up. In this role, your core responsibilities will include:

  • Support day-to-day relationship management for strategic partners, expanding and ensuring both parties’ success
  • Own go-to-market activity, planning and metrics for our ecosystem of Channel partners and VARs.
  • Regularly monitor and nurture health metrics of existing partners.
  • Drive revenue for Sustain Life, based on quarterly goals through generating business with new and established partners, through a combination of enablement and co-selling activity.
  • Driving lead generation with existing partners will include monthly relationship development calls (or more as appropriate based on partner and leadership guidance), quarterly business reviews, and co-marketing activities.
  • Identify and build relationships with multiple stakeholders within an accounting or tech consulting firm.
  • Qualify and conduct deep discovery with net new Accounting/VARs partners and build account plans to drive revenue through the channel account.
  • Deeply understand seller and buyer needs in the partner ecosystem to provide actionable insights for engineering and the broader GTM team
  • Utilizing HubSpot and other PRM and CRM platforms to generate and manage a healthy pipeline of partnership opportunities.

Who you are:

  • 4-6 years of work in partnerships, sales or channel sales, with a track record of exceeding targets
  • Startup experience. You’ve helped build new businesses from the ground up
  • Have familiarity with common SaaS tooling such as Hubspot, ZoomInfo, and implementing PRM systems is a plus
  • Extremely organized individual comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Ability to function and contribute within a team, while also having willingness to accomplish tasks individually successfully
  • Have an open-minded desire to learn, grow and adapt as your responsibilities evolve
  • Effective time management skills with an ability to identify and prioritize essential tasks
  • Outstanding oral and written communication skills
  • Comfortable with a remote working environment

Bonus - experience we'd love to see

  • Startup experience. You’ve helped build new businesses from the ground up
  • A passion for sustainability - You care about climate change and want to be part of the solution

 

Interested? Great - we'd love to talk to you! Please apply to the role on our website https://boards.greenhouse.io/sustainlife. 

If you don’t check every box, don’t let that stop you. We prioritize talent, passion, and drive over what looks good on paper. If you’re on the fence, we encourage you to hit the apply button and highlight what draws you to Sustain.Life.

Sustain.Life is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Women/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Age

 

Who we are:

Sustain.Life is a high-energy early-stage Climate Tech start-up that focuses on providing ESG solutions to our customers to support their ambitions to address the most challenging questions of our time. Our sustainability platform specializes in B2B solutions for corporate sustainability efforts, offering innovative technology solutions and industry experience to support business targets, personal goals and a vision of a sustainable future for everybody on the planet. We are building a team that will help our users launch sustainability programs,, benchmark their ESG performance, measure carbon emissions, set meaningful goals, execute reduction strategies, and ultimately share their progress with key stakeholders. We are on a mission to create best-in-class software that changes the world.

Join us in our mission! We are a fully remote workforce collaborating across US, UK and Ireland. We have an incredible team of world-class experts, designers and technologists developing our sustainability platform, and we were finalists in the 2022 SXSW. We believe in our mission, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us and help us grow.

At Sustain.Life, we take our mission seriously. In 2021, our entire carbon footprint was only 120 Metric Tons of carbon, which we offset on behalf of our employees. Our platform helps us understand our impact on the environment and to take the necessary steps to reduce that impact.
